patches.title: [PATCH] spi: cadence-qspi: Fix runtime PM imbalance in probe
patches.description: Fixed a runtime PM reference count underflow in the Cadence Quad SPI controller driver. The probe function was incorrectly calling pm_runtime_put_autosuspend() twice while only acquiring one reference with pm_runtime_get_sync(), causing usage count to go negative.
patches.impact: Prevents runtime PM subsystem corruption and fixes kernel warning "Runtime PM usage count underflow!" on affected hardware. Ensures correct power management state tracking for SPI controller, preventing potential power management issues during device suspend/resume cycles.

patches.title: [PATCH v3] pinctrl: starfive: use dynamic GPIO base allocation
patches.description: Modernized the StarFive JH7110 (RISC-V SoC) pinctrl driver to use dynamic GPIO base allocation instead of deprecated static assignment. Removed hardcoded gc_base values and associated constants (JH7110_SYS_GC_BASE, JH7110_AON_GC_BASE) that are no longer needed with dynamic allocation.
patches.impact: Eliminates kernel deprecation warning "Static allocation of GPIO base is deprecated, use dynamic allocation." Aligns driver with current GPIO subsystem best practices and prevents potential GPIO numbering conflicts in complex systems. Makes the driver more maintainable and future-proof as the GPIO subsystem moves away from static base assignment.

patches.title: [PATCH] rtl8xxxu: fix slab-out-of-bounds in rtl8xxxu_sta_add
patches.description: Fixed a critical memory safety issue in the rtl8xxxu wireless driver. The driver wasn't setting hw->sta_data_size, causing mac80211 to allocate insufficient space for per-station private data. This resulted in slab-out-of-bounds writes when rtl8xxxu_sta_add() accessed sta->drv_priv members. Bug was caught by KASAN on RISC-V hardware with RTL8192EU adapter.
patches.impact: Fixes memory corruption vulnerability that could cause kernel crashes, data corruption, or potential security issues. Prevents KASAN-detected slab-out-of-bounds write in station addition path. This is a critical correctness fix that ensures proper memory allocation for driver private data structures in mac80211 wireless stack. Also tagged for stable kernel backport.
